events.originalText: Gunmen perpetrated an assault against an Egyptian military checkpoint in the Libyan Desert, killing 22 soldiers.
events.subtitle: 2014 Farafra ambush
events.headline: 22 soldiers killed in Egyptian military checkpoint assault in Libyan Desert

events.originalText: The NASA spacecraft Cassini took a photograph of Saturn with Earth in the distance (detail pictured), for which people were invited to "wave at Saturn".
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA spacecraft Cassini captures Saturn with Earth in the distance

events.originalText: The Troubles: The Provisional Irish Republican Army announced that it would resume its ceasefire, ending its 28-year campaign against British rule in Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: IRA announces ceasefire, ending 28-year campaign against British rule in Northern Ireland

events.originalText: A car bomb killed the anti-Mafia judge Paolo Borsellino and five policemen in Palermo, Italy, less than two months after the murder of Borsellino's friend and colleague Giovanni Falcone.
events.subtitle: Via D'Amelio bombing
events.headline: Anti-Mafia judge Paolo Borsellino killed in car bomb attack in Palermo, Italy

events.originalText: The largely autobiographical novel The Ordeal of Gilbert Pinfold by Evelyn Waugh was published.
events.subtitle: Autobiographical novel
events.headline: Evelyn Waugh's novel 'The Ordeal of Gilbert Pinfold' published

events.originalText: Following Peace Day celebrations marking the end of the First World War, English ex-servicemen unhappy with unemployment and other grievances rioted and burned down Luton Town Hall (pictured).
events.subtitle: Luton Peace Day Riots
events.headline: Riots in Luton as ex-servicemen burn down Town Hall after Peace Day celebrations

events.originalText: First World War: The "worst 24 hours in Australia's entire history" occurred when Australian forces unsuccessfully attacked German defences at Fromelles, France.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Australian forces suffer heavy losses in unsuccessful attack at Fromelles, France

events.originalText: French cyclist Maurice Garin won the first edition of the Tour de France.
events.subtitle: Maurice Garin
events.headline: French cyclist Maurice Garin wins first Tour de France

events.originalText: The two-day Seneca Falls Convention, the first women's-rights and feminist convention held in the United States, opened in Seneca Falls, New York.
events.subtitle: Seneca Falls Convention
events.headline: Seneca Falls Convention opens, first women's-rights convention in the US

events.originalText: A fire in Manhattan, New York, destroyed 345 buildings, killed 30 people, and caused at least $5 million in damage.
events.subtitle: Great New York City Fire of 1845
events.headline: Fire in Manhattan destroys 345 buildings, kills 30, causes $5 million in damage

events.originalText: SS Great Britain, the first ocean-going ship with both an iron hull and a screw propeller, was launched (pictured) in Bristol, England.
events.subtitle: SS Great Britain
events.headline: SS Great Britain launched in Bristol, first ocean-going ship with iron hull and screw propeller

events.originalText: Georg Anton Schäffer was forced to depart for China after his unsuccessful attempt to seize the Hawaiian Kingdom for the Russian Empire.
events.subtitle: Georg Anton Schäffer
events.headline: Georg Anton Schäffer forced to depart for China after failed attempt to seize Hawaiian Kingdom

events.originalText: Great Northern War: Polish–Saxon forces were defeated by a Swedish army half their size at the Battle of Kliszów.
events.subtitle: Great Northern War
events.headline: Swedish army defeats Polish-Saxon forces at Battle of Kliszów

events.originalText: Mary I was proclaimed Queen of England, deposing Lady Jane Grey after nine days of de facto rule.
events.subtitle: Mary I of England
events.headline: Mary I proclaimed Queen of England, deposing Lady Jane Grey

events.originalText: The English warship Mary Rose (pictured) sank just outside Portsmouth during the Battle of the Solent.
events.subtitle: Mary Rose
events.headline: English warship Mary Rose sinks during Battle of the Solent

events.originalText: Arab–Byzantine wars: After initial Byzantine gains at the Battle of Apamea, a lone Kurdish rider killed Byzantine commander Damian Dalassenos, allowing Fatimid troops to turn the tide of the battle.
events.subtitle: Arab–Byzantine wars
events.headline: Kurdish rider turns tide of Battle of Apamea, killing Byzantine commander
